com.mostc.pftt.host
Class SSHHost

java.lang.Object
  com.mostc.pftt.host.Host
      com.mostc.pftt.host.AHost
          com.mostc.pftt.host.RemoteHost
              com.mostc.pftt.host.SSHHost

public class SSHHost
extends RemoteHost

represents a Remote Host accessed via SSH. TROUBLESHOOTING If have problems logging in to OpenSSH (the default SSH server on Linux) Check /etc/ssh/sshd_config for both: PasswordAuthentication yes PermitRootLogin yes Then run `/etc/init.d/sshd restart` or `/etc/init.d/ssh restart` CONFIGURATION Doesn't connect to host until first call to a method that requires being connected to host. This allows SSHHost to be instantiated in config files, etc... without actually creating a connection until one is actually needed. SERVER REQUIREMENTS Remote Host must have an accessible SSH Server. Support SSH Servers: -OpenSSH on Linux -Apache Mina-SSH on Windows SSH Server must support SESSION and SFTP channels (SCP channel not required) NOTE: added 1 line to SftpClient#resolveRemotePath to support checking for [letter]:\ on Windows

Author:
Matt Ficken

getContentsDetectCharset

public java.lang.String getContentsDetectCharset(java.lang.String file,
                                                 CharsetDeciderDecoder cdd)
                                          throws java.io.IOException
Description copied from class: AHost
gets the contents of the file as single unicode string, automatically detecting the character set and converting the bytes to a string (supports exotic charsets like EUC-CN or SHIFT_JS). Note: this takes extra time, often most files can be read with just #getContents because they don't use exotic charsets

Specified by:

execOut

public ExecOutput execOut(java.lang.String cmd,
                          int timeout,
                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> env,
                          byte[] stdin_post,
                          java.nio.charset.Charset charset,
                          java.lang.String chdir)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from class: AHost
executes the given program

Specified by:
execOut in class AHost
Parameters:
cmd - - program to run
timeout - - maximum number of seconds program is allowed to run - terminated if it goes over
stdin_post - - bytes to pass to program's STDIN
charset - - character set to assume program's output is - otherwise it'll autodetect it, which is slower
chdir - - current directory for the program
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
Host.FOUR_HOURS
